laboratory_examinations.findings: The liver has a normal echotexture without any focal hepatic lesions. There is no intrahepatic or extrahepatic biliary dilatation, and the common bile duct measures 4 mm. The main portal vein is patent with normal hepatopetal flow. The gallbladder is distended and noted to contain at least 1 shadowing gallstone. There is associated pericholecystic fluid and gallbladder wall thickening measuring 5 mm. There is a positive sonographic sign.
1.5 mmol/L; NO POLYMORPHONUCLEAR LEUKOCYTES SEEN. NO MICROORGANISMS SEEN.
